Protocols/HasRoutes.html#/s:10Coordinate.name: activeRoute
Protocols/HasRoutes.html#/s:10Coordinate.abstract: The currently active route on this class

Protocols/HasRoutes.html#/s:10Coordinate.name: goTo(_:)
Protocols/HasRoutes.html#/s:10Coordinate.abstract: This method tries to change the route state to the desired parameter. If successful, the property activeRoute will reflect the passed parameter.

Protocols/HasEvents.html#/s:10Coordinate.name: emitEvent(_:)
Protocols/HasEvents.html#/s:10Coordinate.abstract: Emits an Event that will bubble up the UIResponder chain until reaches the first Coordinator, where it will continue to bubble up

Protocols/HasEvents.html#/s:10Coordinate.name: interceptEvent(_:)
Protocols/HasEvents.html#/s:10Coordinate.abstract: Intercepts events and react to them. Return true to stop the event propagation, return false to continue event propagation

Protocols/HasDependencies.html#/s:10Coor.name: dependencies
Protocols/HasDependencies.html#/s:10Coor.abstract: Set this with an object that conform to AppDependenciesProtocol, but never to AppDependenciesProtocol directly.

Protocols/HasDependenciesProtocol.html#/.name: setDependencies(dependencies:)
Protocols/HasDependenciesProtocol.html#/.abstract: This is used intead of a direct property assignment.

Protocols/Coordinating.html#/s:10Coordin.name: identifier
Protocols/Coordinating.html#/s:10Coordin.abstract: Unique string to identify specific Coordinator instance.

Protocols/Coordinated.html.name: Coordinated
Protocols/Coordinated.html.abstract: This protocol is to be appliead to every UIViewController that is a rootViewController of a Coordinator.

Protocols/Coordinating.html.name: Coordinating
Protocols/Coordinating.html.abstract: This protocol is the base for every Coordinator, which is to encapsulate the rootViewController and be able to be coordinated by a parent Coordinator

Protocols.html#/s:10Coordinate23AppDepen.name: AppDependenciesProtocol
Protocols.html#/s:10Coordinate23AppDepen.abstract: Base protocol for AppDependencies, use this as the base of your AppDependecies struct to make it work with the Coordinators.

Protocols/HasDependenciesProtocol.html.name: HasDependenciesProtocol
Protocols/HasDependenciesProtocol.html.abstract: This protocol is for intern use only, do no use it.

Protocols/HasDependencies.html.name: HasDependencies
Protocols/HasDependencies.html.abstract: Use this protocol in your Coordinators to enable automatic dependency injection

Protocols.html#/s:10Coordinate0A6EventsP.name: CoordinateEvents
Protocols.html#/s:10Coordinate0A6EventsP.abstract: Base protocol to be used on the enums that define events

Protocols/HasEvents.html.name: HasEvents
Protocols/HasEvents.html.abstract: Protocol to be used in any Class that needs to emit and intercept events

Protocols/HasRoutes.html.name: HasRoutes
Protocols/HasRoutes.html.abstract: Protocol to indicate your Coordinator has Routes. Future implementation will try and base on this to provide ways of managing routing easier

Extensions/UIResponder.html#/s:So11UIRes.name: emitEvent(_:)
Extensions/UIResponder.html#/s:So11UIRes.abstract: Emits an Event that will bubble up the UIResponder chain until reaches the first Coordinator, where it will continue to bubble up

Extensions/UIResponder.html#/s:So11UIRes.name: interceptEvent(_:)
Extensions/UIResponder.html#/s:So11UIRes.abstract: Intercepts events and react to them. Return true to stop the event propagation, return false to continue event propagation

Classes/TabBarCoordinator.html#/s:10Coor.name: tabTapped(for:)
Classes/TabBarCoordinator.html#/s:10Coor.abstract: Callback for when a Tab is tapped.

Classes/TabBarCoordinator.html#/s:10Coor.name: select(_:)
Classes/TabBarCoordinator.html#/s:10Coor.abstract: Allows you to programatically select a Tab corresponding to the Coordinator you want

Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.name: currentViewControllers
Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.abstract: This is a mirror of the UINavigationController.viewControllers, useful to test later if a UIViewController was popped or not

Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.name: activate()
Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.abstract: Activates the Coordinator. This is called everytime the Coordinator is about to be presented

Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.name: root(_:animated:completion:)
Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.abstract: Convenience method to set the rootViewController from the UINavigationController, or to pop to it in case it is already on the navigation stack.

Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.name: show(_:sender:)
Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.abstract: Analog to UINavigationController’s show(_ vc: UIViewController, sender: Any?)

Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.name: popToCoordinator(_:animated:)
Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.abstract: Analog to UINavigationController’s popToViewController(_ viewController: UIViewController, animated: Bool) -> [UIViewController]?

Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.name: checkPoppedBack(viewController:)
Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.abstract: This method tries to determine if a UIViewController was effectively popped (i.e. is back visually on the navigation stack)

Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.name: poppedBack(to:)
Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.abstract: Callback called with the Coordinator belonging to the UIViewController that was just popped back.

Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.name: navigationController(_:willShow:animated:)
Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.abstract: Called just before the navigation controller displays a view controller’s view and navigation item properties.

Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.name: navigationController(_:didShow:animated:)
Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html#/s:10.abstract: This method will sync the current UINavigationControllers.viewControllers so that we can later use it to determine if a UIViewController was popped or not

Classes/Coordinator.html#/s:10Coordinate.name: init()
Classes/Coordinator.html#/s:10Coordinate.abstract: This is the beginning of the Coordinator Lifecycle. It will set the rootViewController as a instance of T and assign itself as the Coordinator of the same UIViewController.

Classes/Coordinator.html#/s:10Coordinate.name: start(with:)
Classes/Coordinator.html#/s:10Coordinate.abstract: Use this method to start anything that might be necessary before its rootViewController is presented.

Classes/Coordinator.html#/s:10Coordinate.name: stop(with:)
Classes/Coordinator.html#/s:10Coordinate.abstract: Tells the Coordinator that it is done, releases the rootViewController to be cleared out of memory.

Classes/Coordinator.html#/s:10Coordinate.name: emitEvent(_:)
Classes/Coordinator.html#/s:10Coordinate.abstract: Emits an Event that will bubble up the UIResponder chain until reaches the first Coordinator, where it will continue to bubble up

Classes/Coordinator.html#/s:10Coordinate.name: interceptEvent(_:)
Classes/Coordinator.html#/s:10Coordinate.abstract: Intercepts events and react to them. Return true to stop the event propagation, return false to continue event propagation

Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html#/s:10C.name: currentViewController
Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html#/s:10C.abstract: The currently presented UIViewController inside this Coordinator

Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html#/s:10C.name: getCached(_:)
Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html#/s:10C.abstract: Returns a cached children Coordinator if it exists

Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html#/s:10C.name: show(_:sender:)
Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html#/s:10C.abstract: Analog to UIViewController’s show(_ vc: UIViewController, sender: Any?) method but for Coordinators.

Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html#/s:10C.name: present(_:animated:completion:)
Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html#/s:10C.abstract: Analog to UIViewController’s present(_ viewControllerToPresent: UIViewController, animated flag: Bool, completion: (() -> Void)? = nil) method but for Coordinators.

Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html#/s:10C.name: dismiss(animated:completion:)
Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html#/s:10C.abstract: Analog to UIViewController’s dismiss(animated flag: Bool, completion: (() -> Void)? = nil) method but for Coordinators.

Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html#/s:10C.name: root(_:animated:completion:)
Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html#/s:10C.abstract: On a ContainerCoordinator, we can stack other Coordinators and change them with or without animation with this method.

Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html.name: ContainerCoordinator
Classes/ContainerCoordinator.html.abstract: The simplest Coordinator that can have other children Coordinators.

Classes/Coordinator.html.name: Coordinator
Classes/Coordinator.html.abstract: This is the base Coordinator class, for cases that you do not need manage any child Coordinator.

Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html.name: NavigationCoordinator
Classes/NavigationCoordinator.html.abstract: The NavigationCoordinator is a specialized ContainerCoordinator for UINavigationControlelrs

Classes/TabBarCoordinator.html.name: TabBarCoordinator
Classes/TabBarCoordinator.html.abstract: The TabBarCoordinator is a specialized ContainerCoordinator for UITabBarController
